content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: its a great puzzle

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Really do like writing BFS searches so this was pretty fun

Once my solution was good enough to pass one test case they all passed so seems very well written and very easy to understand what is required

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I accept this contribution since it is intresting and fun to solve
feel free to add a test case with more Holes.

Goal section
* Suggest to change "figure"/"array" to "game board".
* Please fix {#} as {{#}}.
* Just to confirm: you write top right is (0, 0) - do you mean top left?
* Suggest to ` ` for monospace text in the example (for the game boards).

Input section
* A brief description is still required for each variable in this section. (Goal section explains them in a more detailed and cohesive manner.)
e.g. "An array [[M]]" may be changed to
A string [[M]] for one row in the game board.
(I find it better to be in the format of variable type + variable name + description)
Please rewrite the line 1 description similarly.

Output section
* Suggest to change "figure" to "game board".

Constraints section
* Please format M as a variable [[M]].

Thanks.

Thank you so much.
I am getting a better understanding of how to write English sentences and how to make questions.
I thought it was inevitable that there would be some shifting, so I am grateful that I learned how to use monospace fonts. (I learned how to do monospace fonts in the comments on the Enlargement question.)
I also found it very helpful to know that there is a way to call the figure a game board and how to explain the variables in the input fields.
Thank you for all the help you gave me.

Thank you.
I have added more test cases.
I think it made the problem more interesting.
